summary: you should do theonsa in winterfell (think robert never came??) and robb finding out
question: you should do theonsa in winterfell (think robert never came??) and robb finding out
answer:
At first, Robb thinks nothing of it.

Sansa visits during their training, Jeyne Poole attached at her hip. Her face is flushed from the cold, he assumes, and her face eager where she usually isn’t.

Although Theon is excellent at archery, he misses his first two shots. “What’s wrong with you?” asks Robb, arms crossed and doing his best not to be smug. “Finally joined us mere mortals in archery?”

Theon huffs, drawing his bow once again. “I twisted my shoulder this morning. Just need to warm it up.” His eyes glance sideways - towards their audience - before he stands straighter.

Robb frowns when Sansa stands taller too.

This time, Theon hits the center of the target. Grinning widely, Theon turns back to Robb. “Mere mortal indeed.”

Robb rolls his eyes and takes his own spot, perhaps missing Theon winking off into the distance.

–

Suspicions grow weeks later, over dinner. Theon sits beside him, as he always does; but his attention is on the other side of the hall, where his sisters sit.

“Are Arya and Sansa fighting again?” Robb asks between bites of meat. “Or did Mother - ”

“I will be back,” says Theon abruptly. He leaves the room without warning, Robb left staring at his back, jaw slack. 

As he reaches for his goblet, he spots a flash of red hair in the corner of his eye. Sansa slips out the hall - the same direction as Theon…

Jon takes Theon’s empty seat, promptly begins a rousing discussion on the merits of sneaking out of the castle that night, and Robb forgets his suspicions.

–

It’s the night he overhears them that confirms it.

“My Lady, we must tell your family soon. If I have to hear of one more marriage proposal…”

“I am just as sick of finding reasons to reject them. Father may think I’m flighty.”

“You scare them away with your fire and beauty. A true lady wolf.”

“Wolves are also loyal to their pack. Their family. Whether by blood or by choice.”

A pause and Robb steps closer as he hears shuffling. “I still cannot believe you chose me, my Lady.”

“Once you decided interest in me… I don’t think I ever had a chance.”

The voices silence, but Robb knows they are still there. Their shadows grow close in the hallway and Robb does not hear their retreat. So instead, Robb leaves - perhaps he should stay. But he’s heard enough.

–

The next day, when Theon and Sansa share a secret glance and smile over breakfast, Robb rolls his eyes and elbows Theon in the stomach. “You need to work on the art of subtly, Greyjoy. Sansa may enjoy you looking like a lovestruck fool, but others in the family may not be as receptive.”

Theon chokes on his ale in response.

Slapping him on the back, Robb holds back a grin, instead forcing his voice to sound menacing. “Tell Father.” Theon nods, still gathering his wits and Robbs lets the grin free. “And find a better hiding spot.”

As Theon turns red, Robb turns away, pleased.

blog.name: springwolvesofwinterfell
blog.title: Spring comes to Winterfell
blog.description: My personal collection of GoT/ ASoIaF

title: 8x04 Some takeaways (P1)
body:
Although I’m quite frustrated that D&D still deprive us of Starks’ moments and the pack vibes, in general, 8x04 is quite a good episode in my opinion. Here I’d like to share with you my thoughts on some of the key moments in the episode. I will mainly focus on the state of warfare, my interpretation of the main players’ motivations and concerns, and my view on whether their decisions (based on the set of information each one has in hand) are good for the realm. Always keep in mind that beside Family-Duty-Honour, the running theme since the beginning of the series has always been anti-war. 

1. Fact: The Stark-Targaryen alliance is not in good shape for another warfare

The episode starts with the aftermath of the Long Night. Tens of thousand died. The survivors are all wounded, drained out and devastated. Let’s do some maths to compare the Stark-Dany’s force to that of Cersei-Euron’s at the moment.

  • Stark-Dany: Before the battle against the Dead, the North and Vale had 20.000 soldiers. Dany had around 40.000 Dothrak, 8.000 Unsullied (maybe less, since she lost quite a number of them in Meereen and during the attack to Casterly Rock), the remaining of Yara’s force and 2 dragons. In total, they had around 70.000 soldiers and 2 dragons. After the battle, the size of the alliance shrinks massively. Half of the Unsullied are gone and so are the Northmen, so I assume the same survival ratio applies to the Vale and Dothraki. Thus, altogether they have around 25.000- 30.000 soldiers left and 2 dragons, however all in bad shape. 
  • Cersei-Euron: the remaining of the Lannister army, the Iron Fleet (at full strength), 20.000 sellswords from the Golden Company. So I assume they have more or less the same number of soldiers as Stark-Dany alliance. Well-rested, well-armed, well-positioned for defense behind the high walls of KL, and fully-equipped with balistas to counter the dragons. 

I will discuss the rational strategy for each side in later part. For now, we clearly see that any wise leader must understand this is not the time to wage another war. Best thing to do now is giving everyone a rest to recover from the battle fatigue before starting a new campaign. (Or not to actively wage another war at all. But if they really have to, first give the soldiers a break.)

2. The King’s speech

As usual, Jon delivered his iconic “coming together” speech. Despite giving away his crown, he is still the true commander-in-chief. By the way, where was Dany? The Queen is not really familiar with “setting aside differences to fight and die together so that others might live”, hers are more about “will you kill my enemies in their iron suits and tear down their stone houses” or “bend the knee or die”. So Jon took the job, and he did it well. 

It is our duty and honor to keep them alive in memory for those who come after us and those who come after them for as long as men draw breath.

Highlight: This war for the survival of mankind is a war worth fighting and dying for, because it ensures hope and a surviving chance for the future generations. (But the coming war for the Throne might not because it sacrifices lives for power.) Note that Sansa was always in the background during this part of Jon’s speech.  –> Hint: They might very well be the ones that pass on these memories of the heroes who died fighting to the living to the future generations. They will have children and grandchildren of their own, perhaps?

3. Dany legitimizing Gendry as a way to exert her power

The next scene was the banquet, where Dany legitimized Gendry to everyone’s surprise. There was tension in the Hall with several reaction shots before Dany finally revealed her offer to make him Lord Gendry Baratheon of Storm’s End.

Gif: gendry-aryas

Tyrion: And a Lord of Storm’s End who will be forever loyal to you. 

Dany: See? You’re not the only one who’s clever. 

Was Dany trying to gain an ally? Not necessarily. Gendry does not have yet any bannermen or wealth, so he is not of immediate use to her. What Dany wanted to show people was, she was a powerful Queen who was to fear, but she could grant mercy as she wished and make or break a Lord in just seconds. Pay attention to her word choice. She first highlighted to Gendry his father’s crimes to her family and herself to make him scared: “You are aware he took my family’s throne and tried to have me murdered?”. Then she showed everyone that she could be merciful if she wanted to, and she could grant one title and wealth at her will, “You are Lord Gendry Baratheon of Storm’s End, the lawful son of Robert Baratheon. Because that is what I have made you.” 

If Dany really wanted to reward Gendry because of his contribution in the war, she would have highlighted the fact that he fought bravely and he was a great blacksmith who forged the weapons to fight the Dead, so he deserved this. No. She didn’t talk about his contribution at all. She made it clear to everyone, he became a Lord because she wanted to. 

People in the background chanted: That’s easy, isn’t it?

If the Queen could easily do everything at her will, she could make a Lord and give wealth to him in seconds, then she can strip away titles and wealth in seconds too. What is more interesting was the exchanging look between Tyrion and Sansa thereafter, both did not seem to be excited with the Queen’s generousity at all. They both knew that the relationship between the Queen and the Lady of Winterfell was strained and tried to figure out what kind of underlying message Dany wanted to convey. 

My interpretation: The Queen was sending a “fair warning” to the Lady of Winterfell. See how easily I reward Gendry, a bastard son of the man who stole the Throne from my family? You’d better behave, or I can strip you off your title and land as easily as I make a Lord out of him. 

Gif: allons-ymrholmes

So very probably, Dany wanted to warn Sansa that the Queen could strip away her land and title at ease. But if she intends to do so, who would she grant Winterfell to? The possible candidates are Bran (the only living trueborn son of Ned) and Jon (the supposed bastard, if he stays silent about his parentage). Some of you might think that this is a very Tywinesque move that Dany could never think of. But I think this is very possible. Otherwise, Sansa and Tyrion would not have exchanged that suspicious look.

Both Tyrion and Sansa were aware of Dany’s possible hidden agenda. Tyrion then did a bit of reality check with Bran. He was always curious about the crippled boy and his adventure, and now he wanted to test what the boy wanted. He praised Bran’s extensive knowledge and said that it would be useful as Lord of Winterfell. Arghh, but Sansa is currently the Lady of Winterfell, why did Tyrion give hint to Bran that he was the only trueborn son of Ned Stark and should be the Lord of Winterfell? I think Tyrion was trying to figure out the power dynamic within the Stark family and what each of them might want. Do they want power, or do they want something else? Bran made it clear to Tyrion that he didn’t really want to be the Lord of Winterfell anymore. (Maybe he did when he was a kid, but now he doesn’t.) Tyrion didn’t know about Jon’s parentage yet, so to his knowledge the contenders for Winterfell are only Jon and Sansa. In Tyrion’s eyes, Jon is clearly in Dany’s favor since he is her lover. If Dany legitimizes Jon and gives Winterfell to him, Sansa would be empty-handed. To certain extent, Tyrion cares for Sansa’s well-being, that’s why he approached Sansa and raised his concerns to her before he left.

- to be continued -

The Queen is not really familiar with “setting aside differences to fight and die together so that others might live”, hers are more about “will you kill my enemies in their iron suits and tear down their stone houses” or “bend the knee or die”. So Jon took the job, and he did it well.

To certain extent, Tyrion cares for Sansa’s well-being, that’s why he approached Sansa and raised his concerns to her before he left.

trail.content_raw:
Although I’m quite frustrated that D&D still deprive us of Starks’ moments and the pack vibes, in general, 8x04 is quite a good episode in my opinion. Here I’d like to share with you my thoughts on some of the key moments in the episode. I will mainly focus on the state of warfare, my interpretation of the main players’ motivations and concerns, and my view on whether their decisions (based on the set of information each one has in hand) are good for the realm. Always keep in mind that beside Family-Duty-Honour, the running theme since the beginning of the series has always been anti-war. 

1. Fact: The Stark-Targaryen alliance is not in good shape for another warfare

The episode starts with the aftermath of the Long Night. Tens of thousand died. The survivors are all wounded, drained out and devastated. Let’s do some maths to compare the Stark-Dany’s force to that of Cersei-Euron’s at the moment.

  • Stark-Dany: Before the battle against the Dead, the North and Vale had 20.000 soldiers. Dany had around 40.000 Dothrak, 8.000 Unsullied (maybe less, since she lost quite a number of them in Meereen and during the attack to Casterly Rock), the remaining of Yara’s force and 2 dragons. In total, they had around 70.000 soldiers and 2 dragons. After the battle, the size of the alliance shrinks massively. Half of the Unsullied are gone and so are the Northmen, so I assume the same survival ratio applies to the Vale and Dothraki. Thus, altogether they have around 25.000- 30.000 soldiers left and 2 dragons, however all in bad shape. 
  • Cersei-Euron: the remaining of the Lannister army, the Iron Fleet (at full strength), 20.000 sellswords from the Golden Company. So I assume they have more or less the same number of soldiers as Stark-Dany alliance. Well-rested, well-armed, well-positioned for defense behind the high walls of KL, and fully-equipped with balistas to counter the dragons. 

I will discuss the rational strategy for each side in later part. For now, we clearly see that any wise leader must understand this is not the time to wage another war. summary:
Ned Stark – The Ghost
Ned Stark, patriarch of the family until his death. He now haunts the Stark Manor and the forest they own....
body:
Got Magic AU – Part 1

Ned Stark – The Ghost

Ned Stark, patriarch of the family until his death. He now haunts the Stark Manor and the forest they own. Only his family members possessing magical powers/being supernatural beings can see him.

Catelyn Stark – The Undead

Catelyn Stark is the matriarch of the Stark family. She has been killed but is now an Undead. She looks like a living person thanks to a charm made by Sansa but her true appearance is the one of a corpse and she is mute due to her throat being slit. Catelyn cannot die again unless she is burnt or decapitated and thus is not afraid to put herself in danger for her family. Since she is a descendant of powerful witches, she is the reason her children and herself have powers.

Robb Stark – The War Spirit

Robb Stark is the first son of Ned and Catelyn. After his father’s murder, he becomes mad with grief and fury. He gets lost in the Northern Woods where he is found by War Spirits who make him one of their own to allow him to get his revenge. He is the most prone to violence in the family and can lash out easily. He is also over protective of his family. As a War Spirit, Robb can summon a full armour, a horse and a sword to slay his enemies.

Sansa Stark – The Witch

Sansa Stark is the second child of Ned and Catelyn. After her father’s death, her witch powers awaken. She is easily one of the most powerful members of the Stark and is behind Catelyn’s charm and Bran’s survival after he is attacked. She is the first to see her father’s ghost. Sansa’s powers includes the creation of charms, telekinesis and the creation of illusions. Blood and bones can make her magic stronger but she refuses to use them and she uses runes and crystals as vessels.

Arya Stark – The Vampire

After her father’s death, Arya Stark runs away from home and is found by Jaqen, a vampire who attacks her. She survives thanks to Robb’s intervention and her witch heritage and becomes a vampire. Stronger and faster than human, she is prone to mood swings for a while because of bloodlust but leans to control it. She wants to avenge her father and protect her family more than anything. Arya’s closest sibling was Jon and she is heartbroken when he joins the Order.

Bran Stark – The Druid

Bran Stark is the fourth child of Catelyn and Ned. His Druid powers allow him to control animals and to have visions. His powers awoke after his father’s death, just like Sansa’s, and they grew closer after. He is attacked by Jaime Lannister a few months later and is crippled as a result. This attack was the official beginning of the war between the Lannisters and the Starks.

Rickon Stark – The Werewolf

Last child of Ned and Catelyn, Rickon is a young boy who is turned into a werewolf after being attacked in the woods. He was following Robb, worried for his brother. His wolf form is huge and black, and is uncontrollable because it is the incarnation of Rickon’s pain and suffering.

Theon Greyjoy – The Kraken

Theon Greyjoy was placed in the Stark’s care when he was nine after his father was arrested for child abuse. Theon resented Ned for a while throughout his childhood because he was the judge who condemned his father and he is hesitant in joining the war. However, Jon’s betrayal makes him realize that he truly cares for the Starks and saves Rickon on his own. He is a water spirit, just like all the other member of his family and can manipulate water.

Jon Snow – The Hunter

Jon Snow is Ned Stark’s nephew who has been adopted by Ned and Catelyn after his birth due to his mother’s death. He distanced himself from his brothers’ and sisters’ after learning about his true parentage. After Ned’s death and the Starks becoming supernatural beings due to Catelyn’s heritage, he feels even more like an outcast. After one of Arya’s violent mood swings, the sibling of whom he was the closest, he becomes terrified and joins the Order, an organisation hunting supernatural beings, hoping to “cure” his family.

Got Magic AU – Part 1

Ned Stark – The Ghost

Ned Stark, patriarch of the family until his death. He now haunts the Stark Manor and the forest they own. Only his family members possessing magical powers/being supernatural beings can see him.

Catelyn Stark – The Undead

Catelyn Stark is the matriarch of the Stark family. She has been killed but is now an Undead. She looks like a living person thanks to a charm made by Sansa but her true appearance is the one of a corpse and she is mute due to her throat being slit. Catelyn cannot die again unless she is burnt or decapitated and thus is not afraid to put herself in danger for her family. Since she is a descendant of powerful witches, she is the reason her children and herself have powers.

Robb Stark – The War Spirit

Robb Stark is the first son of Ned and Catelyn. After his father’s murder, he becomes mad with grief and fury. He gets lost in the Northern Woods where he is found by War Spirits who make him one of their own to allow him to get his revenge. He is the most prone to violence in the family and can lash out easily. He is also over protective of his family. As a War Spirit, Robb can summon a full armour, a horse and a sword to slay his enemies.

Sansa Stark – The Witch

Sansa Stark is the second child of Ned and Catelyn. After her father’s death, her witch powers awaken. She is easily one of the most powerful members of the Stark and is behind Catelyn’s charm and Bran’s survival after he is attacked. She is the first to see her father’s ghost. Sansa’s powers includes the creation of charms, telekinesis and the creation of illusions. Blood and bones can make her magic stronger but she refuses to use them and she uses runes and crystals as vessels.

Arya Stark – The Vampire

After her father’s death, Arya Stark runs away from home and is found by Jaqen, a vampire who attacks her. She survives thanks to Robb’s intervention and her witch heritage and becomes a vampire. Stronger and faster than human, she is prone to mood swings for a while because of bloodlust but leans to control it. She wants to avenge her father and protect her family more than anything. Arya’s closest sibling was Jon and she is heartbroken when he joins the Order.

Bran Stark – The Druid

Bran Stark is the fourth child of Catelyn and Ned. His Druid powers allow him to control animals and to have visions. His powers awoke after his father’s death, just like Sansa’s, and they grew closer after. He is attacked by Jaime Lannister a few months later and is crippled as a result. This attack was the official beginning of the war between the Lannisters and the Starks.

Rickon Stark – The Werewolf

Last child of Ned and Catelyn, Rickon is a young boy who is turned into a werewolf after being attacked in the woods. He was following Robb, worried for his brother. His wolf form is huge and black, and is uncontrollable because it is the incarnation of Rickon’s pain and suffering.

Theon Greyjoy – The Kraken

Theon Greyjoy was placed in the Stark’s care when he was nine after his father was arrested for child abuse. Theon resented Ned for a while throughout his childhood because he was the judge who condemned his father and he is hesitant in joining the war. However, Jon’s betrayal makes him realize that he truly cares for the Starks and saves Rickon on his own. He is a water spirit, just like all the other member of his family and can manipulate water.

Jon Snow – The Hunter

Jon Snow is Ned Stark’s nephew who has been adopted by Ned and Catelyn after his birth due to his mother’s death. He distanced himself from his brothers’ and sisters’ after learning about his true parentage. After Ned’s death and the Starks becoming supernatural beings due to Catelyn’s heritage, he feels even more like an outcast. After one of Arya’s violent mood swings, the sibling of whom he was the closest, he becomes terrified and joins the Order, an organisation hunting supernatural beings, hoping to “cure” his family.

body: I’m trying to stay positive but the idea that D&D can wrap up the series in the next 2 episodes is a joke to me. They severely lack the writing skills and I’m afraid even if jonsa or dark!dany were to be true it will be executed so poorly that I wont be able to support or enjoy it. Everything is rushed and character povs are being hidden for the sake of “shock value”. I dont even know who Jon’s character is anymore. I’m just hoping that the leaks for next week aren’t true because I wont be able to support Sansa either.

summary: This is probably an unpopular opinion, but it literally just popped into my head rn because I was looking at a gif of Sansa and...
body:
This is probably an unpopular opinion, but it literally just popped into my head rn because I was looking at a gif of Sansa and Sandor smiling at each other.

As much as me 4 years ago thought that their story held a touch of romance, I don’t think it does like most consumers think. I definitely think there’s a romantic element, Sandor being a true knight is high romance in terms of story telling and narrative. Do I think they’re going to get married and have Sansan babies? naw. He’s definitely a paternal role for her, someone she could trust, someone who protected her. 

And here’s the unpopular bit. 

The show doesn’t really provide a romantic lead for Sansa, which leads me to believe that GRRM either doesn’t have one (I call hell no, she’s the LADY of Winterfell, was betrothed to the future king of the seven kingdoms, and then married to Tyrion). Or it’s someone seemingly out of left field. Sansa is GOING to get married. And I think she’ll marry Gendry. The show has him legitimized, he’s Lord of Storm’s End, and Arya has already rejected his proposal because she doesn’t want to be a lady. Gendry has land, a house, a title, he needs a Lady wife. She was the bastard Alayne for a bit and has that unique experience where she can somewhat identify with Gendry (since I do NOT think that Jon and Sansa will be a romantic couple). 

Where Cat married the other Stark brother, I think Gendry might marry the other Stark sister. And it comes back to Robert’s “You have a daughter, I have a son.” Sansa will wind up with Gendry. Yeah it might be awkward in the show since D&D had Gendry and Arya sleep together (fanservice), but the possibility is open in book realm. That kind of rankles me, since Gendry and Arya were so sweet to think about in book realm, these two kids bonding over trauma, but idk. It makes sense, especially if Arya is sure of her “I’ll never be a lady! Murder for lyfe!” If Gendrya doesn’t happen, I guess Sandry could. Gensa?

summary: The Dany squad using Ned as "member" of Dany's defense and how Ned would be displeased in his children's treatment of her and...
question: The Dany squad using Ned as "member" of Dany's defense and how Ned would be displeased in his children's treatment of her and most importantly Sansa... I'm howling! Why are they like that?
answer:
Ned literally fought to remove the Targaryens, he wouldn’t want Dany on the throne. He just didn’t see the point of assassinating her when she was doing nothing wrong in his eyes. If he knew she planned on killing thousands of people for no good reason, he’d fight her. 

Dany stans logging on Tumblr to be the dumbest fuckers on the planet

summary: Browsing through Dany and Arya stan blogs that are yelling about Book!Sansa I can see that they LIKE and ENJOY Sansa being...
question: Browsing through Dany and Arya stan blogs that are yelling about Book!Sansa I can see that they LIKE and ENJOY Sansa being abused by LF. It's not even subtle. One of them actually wrote it. They wrote Sansa should've died with LF. That's the aspect they enjoy- the abuse she suffers, how abusive men rob her of her agency. They never want Sansa to come to WF. THey want her to be raped, mistreated, executed. This is their real face. When they say they like Book!Sansa,they like her subservient
answer: Show Sansa has more agency and power than book Sansa and it makes them so mad it’s funny. After calling book Sansa an abuser (honestly you would have a hard time naming characters she hasn’t been accused of abusing), they are now claiming she’s so sweet she’d kiss Dany’s ass and become Arya’s servant. This is why no one outside of their fandoms (this includes people who claim Sansa is their favourite character because we all know they’re lying) falls for their concern trolling. We can see right through them probably because they don’t do a good job of hiding just how much they hate both Sansas

summary: There are four main female characters in the show, Dany, Cersei, Sansa and Arya and all of them are portrayed as either...
body: There are four main female characters in the show, Dany, Cersei, Sansa and Arya and all of them are portrayed as either villainous or problematic in one way or another.  And yet the main male characters are portrayed as the voices of reason. It makes me sick.
